intro: Echites prieurei, commonly known as the Prieure's spurge, is a perennial shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It features upright stems covered in sticky, milky sap, which is a characteristic feature of the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers clustered in umbels, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a waxy texture with serrated edges. Echites prieurei is often found in rocky or dry soils and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
